page.title: 07BUTTERWOOD. THE BMX TRACK
page.content:
The woodland area near the M3 Junction is called Butterwood. A variety of mature, deciduous trees thrive in the wet and boggy woodland. It is a rich and fertile habitat, supporting a wide variety of wild-life.Many kinds of birds nest in the trees. There are Rabbits and Grass snakes in the wood and a varied assortment of plant-life.
THE BMX TRACK. The BMX Cycle Track at Bartley Heath is a practice area for the members of a group called "Terry's Tigers". It was founded by the local police-man and covers an area of about four acres of land. Club members perform at local shows and fetes in the surrounding areas. The club was started in 1983 and has over two hundred members of all ages. It is a very popular sport.
